title.rendered: “IDF Forces Dismantle Terrorist’s Home, Arrest Nine Suspects in Judea and Samaria: An In-depth Report on Recent Security Operations”

content.rendered:
IDF spokesperson:

IDF forces demolished the house of the terrorist who carried out the attack near the Al-Zaeem checkpoint. The IDF, Shabak (Israel Security Agency) and Border Police operated last night to arrest nine wanted individuals throughout Judea and Samaria.

The forces demolished the house of the terrorist Kizam Issa Ali Zawahra in Zaatara in the Gush Etzion brigade, one of the terrorists who carried out the shooting attack near the Al-Zaeem checkpoint on 02/22 in which Matan Eilmeleh was killed and others were injured.

In Tulkarm, in the Menashe brigade, the forces arrested a wanted individual, conducted searches of buildings, and investigated additional suspects. In Hebron, in the Judea brigade, two wanted individuals were arrested and a Carlo type rifle was confiscated in Bitah in the brigade sector.

During activities in the city of Nablus in the Samaria brigade and Al-Aroub in the Gush Etzion brigade, the fighters arrested two wanted individuals and confiscated incitement materials. In Al-Amari in the Binyamin brigade, a wanted individual affiliated with the terrorist organization Hamas was arrested.

Yesterday evening, shots were fired at the settlement of Ma’ale Muvhas from the depth of the village of Jilbon, hits were identified in two homes in the settlement and bullets were found in them. No injuries were reported.

The arrested individuals and the confiscated weapons were handed over for further investigation to the security forces; no injuries were reported among our forces.

Since the beginning of the war, about 3,700 wanted individuals have been arrested throughout the Judea and Samaria division and in the Jordan Valley and the Valleys division, about 1,600 of them are affiliated with the terrorist organization Hamas.

Attached are photos of the forces’ activities throughout Judea and Samaria: https://idfanc.activetrail.biz/ANC0904202465846863.
